channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Wardour Street 30metres from Shaftesbury Avenue junction, utility box graffitid, 13th September

item.title: Constant littering due to no public bins on Andrews Rd., 13th September
item.description:
There are no public bins on andrews road that leads from Broadway market to mare street, which is a complete oversight from the council and when you report the littering the council doesn’t do anything.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Andrews Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuing fly tipping of residents rubbish on corner of Mackenzie Road and Beckenham Road, 13th September
item.description:
This is a continuous problem that is occurring on a daily basis, it has been going on since August and despite the council’s efforts the problem has not been resolved

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, London

item.title: Alarm at Riverside Engage doesn’t stop, 13th September
item.description:
The alarm outside Riverside Engage Hackney (5 Laburnum Street) keeps going off - it happened on Fri 12 Sept throughout the afternoon and evening and now on Sat 13 Sept at 10.30am.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Laburnum Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass over the pathway in along the pathway in park, 13th September
item.description:
As enter gate near sandhurst road (up from the pedestrian crossing) the path into Danson park has broken glass which is a hazzard for children and pets . needs ‘vacuuming’ up as lots of small bits and larger bits. potentially quite a nasty accident if a child fallls over there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge on pavement trip hazard and now bag with wood in road, 13th September
item.description:
Fridge reported in July as not removed people appear to feel it is a good place to continue dumping items hence large bag of wood now in situ. Not sure why Greenwich will not remove the fridge, it’s a trip hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Borthwick Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet
